Description: Gold finger-ring: with an oval bezel decorated with an incised figure of the goddess Mut, in a boat with the prow and stern in the form of papyrus heads. She is seated on a throne under a canopy supported by papyrus columns. There is an inscription in front of Mut. The ring is heavy with a deep bezel. It is made of sheet gold over a core.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: The British Museum, 'A Guide to the First and Second Egyptian Rooms' (London, 1904), no. 238, p. 218; E. A. Wallis Budge 'A Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room' (London, 1922), no. 238, p. 92; 'Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt' [exhibition catalogue] (Japan 1999-2000), No 34. Published: Andrews, Amulets of Ancient Egypt (1994): fig.45
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2001 26 Jun-23 Sep, Birmingham Gas Hall, Egypt Revealed Travelling exhibition, Jewellery 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum. Egyptian Written Culture. 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
